So this problem arises with my folding wing SSTO, and the basics of it are that after undocking the bottom ports to fold the craft up, it refuses to fold back down as the docking ports haven't moved 10m from each other. 

Any tips other than f5 + f9? Id greatly appreciate it if 'theres a mod for that' came into effect here.

That's weird, I have a similar design for a stock rotating wing VTOL and I think it's docking ports are even closer than that but it works fine. (It's ugly as all sin, I know...it's a prototype lol; cut it some slack!)

I wonder what the difference is? Anyways, I've heard people claim that "controlling from here" on the docking ports involved can help fix the issue.

On 11/19/2017 at 6:52 PM, Not Sure said:

Any tips other than f5 + f9?

Well, you could use ModuleManager to tweak the reset distance on docking ports to something smaller.

If being able to visualize the behavior would be helpful, you may want to consider IndicatorLights.  Among other things, it adds glowing LEDs to the docking ports to indicate their status.  They blink rapidly when the docking field engages.  After undocking, they blink slowly until the ports have reset.  So that can at least let you know when you've nailed it.  (The mod also adds indicators to tons of other parts besides docking ports, but if you don't like that, you can easily whittle it down by just deleting all the .cfg files for everything except the ports, if you like.)
